qas.question: Guinea-Bissau is larger than what two countries?
How high is the highest point in Guinea-Bissau?
What archipelago lies off the mainland?
How many square kilometers is Guinea-Bissau?
Where does Guinea-Bissau get its hot dry winds from?

context: At <a3_0>36,125<a3_0/> square kilometres (13,948 sq mi), the country is larger in size than <a0_0>Taiwan or Belgium<a0_0/>. It lies at a low altitude; its highest point is <a1_0>300 metres (984 ft)<a1_0/>. The terrain of is mostly low coastal plain with swamps of Guinean mangroves rising to Guinean forest-savanna mosaic in the east. Its monsoon-like rainy season alternates with periods of hot, dry harmattan winds blowing from <a4_0>the Sahara<a4_0/>. The <a2_0>Bijagos<a2_0/> Archipelago lies off of the mainland.
